Class TimerThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • TimerThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TimerThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    TimerThread class defines a resetable timer, which beeps when the timerDisplay set is has elapsed. The TimerThread will notify the object registered when timer is instantiated.
    Author:
    JillianJiggs

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

      private int clock
      Initial amount of time to complete the round before the game is over;
      protected int decrementTimer
      The amount of elapsed time during game play.
      private TimerDisplay timerDisplay
      The object to notify to update time & time display

      void run()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        If this thread was constructed using a separate Runnable run object, then that Runnable object's run method is called; otherwise, this method does nothing and returns. Overrides the run() in the parent class
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
